p: The grass Calamagrostis epigejos occurs significantly more often in the sand heaps and in the forest ( Table 1). On the other hand, on the study site SH, on which the sand is stabilized by the roots of the grasses Corynephorus canescens and Cynodon dactylon L. dominated, Black locust ( Robinia pseudoacacia) also occurs. The final stage of succession is the formation of black locust thickets or a black locust forest (study site SH), willow scrubs (study site ST), and a mosaic of rushes and willow scrubs (study site WT).
